docblock.description: WordPress clean-up tweaks such as removing emojis, stripping script style versions, etc.
Disable WP Emojis
Disable WP Emojis in TinyMCE Editor
Strip WordPress script versions on the front end

tag.name: param
tag.description: The style/script loader src in WP filter script_loader_src

docblock.description: Strip WordPress version on the front end
Strip WP admin bar for any non-admin user on the front end

parse_markers.error: Argument $plugins is missing from the Docblock of kmw_disable_emojicons_tinymce

docblock.description: Content formatting filters such as trademark and registration mark.
Standardize trademark and registration marks.
docblock.long-description: Please remember that people are generally very varied. There will be a myriad different way people can enter different content different ways on a site. These were useful in one specific instance for me, but maybe your client decided to wrap every registration mark with a span and custom inline styling (sorry for ya). These content formatting filters can (and *should*) only go so far. If you wind up with many dozens of lines in this file, something is going wrong in the content pipeline, and you may want to attempt to address that through your organization, client, whoever you're working for.

parse_markers.error: Argument $content is missing from the Docblock of kmw_format_the_content

docblock.description: Persistent analytics.
docblock.long-description: "Safer" than anything theme-based and even plugin-based. Because you're loading this file as a mu-plugin, it will *always* run even if you change the theme and even if you deactivate your other SEO plugins. Helps you avoid losing your precious GA data!

docblock.description: Add Google Analytics to site.
Template-related functions intended to be used in your own PHP theme templates. Some of them have shortcodes, too, but they're mostly intended to be theme templates.
More useful WordPress 404 & error text.
docblock.long-description: For use in the 404 template and sometimes the "none" template, depending on the site type. **MUST-CUSTOMIZE: Pay attention to the URLs -- e.g., sitemap, contact. They might be different for you and I can't guess what your page names/permalinks are.**

docblock.description: Truncate text.
docblock.long-description: Shortens a longer text (for example: the excerpt, the content, a custom meta value) to a number of characters you specify. The number is optional and defaults to 25.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The number of characters where you wish to truncate.

docblock.description: Truncate text as a shortcode.
Truncate text as a PHP template function.
Faux-dropdown sorting for WordPress categories.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the WordPress taxonomy you wish to display.

docblock.description: Plugin Name: KMW Functions & Shortcodes Plugin URI: https://github.com/kmwalsh/KMW-Functions-Shortcodes Description: Some useful custom functions, shortcodes, content formatting filters, and WordPress clean-up/tweaks.
docblock.long-description: Author: K. M. Walsh Author URI: http://katemwalsh.com Version: 2.0.0

docblock.description: Enqueue scripts and styles for this plugin.
Custom WordPress shortcodes for things such as logged in/out content, the current year, social media icons, etc.

WordPress shortcode with start and end tags. Produces text visible only to Logged Out users. **Note:** This is only for small tidbits like a login form on the sidebar etc. There are much better ways to protect content with much more granular permissions than this offers, this is basically just for "calls to action" and other very simple stuff.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The content you want only logged out users to see.

docblock.description: WordPress shortcode with start and end tags. Produces text visible only to Logged In users. **Note:** This is only for small tidbits like a login form on the sidebar etc. There are much better ways to protect content with much more granular permissions than this offers, this is basically just for "calls to action" and other very simple stuff.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The content you want only logged in users to see. Accepts shortcodes.

docblock.description: WordPress shortcode with start and end tags. Produces buttons with optional subtitle.

tag.name: param
tag.description: WordPress shortcode attributes. Contains three arguments. $link, where you want the button to go. $target, whether you want the button to open in a new window, use _blank or _new. And finally $subtitle, the smaller text contained within the button.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The content you want in the button. Accepts shortcodes.

docblock.description: Social media icons. Default social media networks: Twitter, Facebook, GitHub, Codepen, Instagram, Pinterest, Reddit, LinkedIn, SoundCloud, YouTube, RSS, E-Mail
Google maps embed code. Useful so you don't have to change the Google map twenty times if the code changes, etc.

tag.name: param
tag.description: WordPress shortcode attributes $width and $height for the map. Can accept pixel, percentage, or whatever else you'd like.

docblock.description: Phone number shortcode: in-content or click to call for mobile.
docblock.long-description: Desktop or click-to-call for mobile Again, useful so you don't have to change it twenty times if the phone number changes (which it can -- call forwarding/tracking services are a great reason to make use of this code). **Note: You should *only* include the mobile number *once*.**

tag.name: param
tag.description: WordPress shortcode atttributes. mobile Whether this instance is the floating phone number that only appears for mobile browsers. number The number type. Default types are phone or fax.

tag.name: todo
tag.description: Support any phone number input here through shortcode and regex or something to clean non numerics and then reformat number for consistent display.

docblock.description: HTML sitemap: Categories + Pages, two column.
docblock.long-description: HTML sitemap pages are useful for human visitors. This is a two-part shortcode because I usually use two separate shortcodes, each in one column. It's also useful to sometimes display just the pages or just the categories (outside of widgets etc.).

docblock.description: HTML sitemap: Categories.
docblock.long-description: HTML sitemap pages are useful for human visitors. This is a two-part shortcode because I usually use two separate shortcodes, each in one column. It's also useful to sometimes display just the pages or just the categories (outside of widgets etc.). ```[kmw_categories]``` simply fetches a list of your blog categories.

docblock.description: HTML sitemap: Pages.
docblock.long-description: HTML sitemap pages are useful for human visitors. This is a two-part shortcode because I usually use two separate shortcodes, each in one column. It's also useful to sometimes display just the pages or just the categories (outside of widgets etc.). This function duplicates the primary menu since you might have "off-menu" pages you don't want to display. If you want a straight list of all pages regardless of the menu, you'll want [wp_list_pages()](http://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/wp_list_pages).

tag.name: param
tag.description: Note: you need to change this to the location of your primary menu.

docblock.description: get_bloginfo() as shortcode.
docblock.long-description: Uses ```get_bloginfo()``` to return data about the website. See [get_bloginfo() on the Codex](https://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/get_bloginfo) for a full list of what can be returned with the key. Useful for placing the site's name in content. If your site rebrands later, you won't need to change the name in a million places *or* mess with MySQL replacements.

tag.name: param
tag.description: WordPress shortcode attributes. Contains key, the key of the get_bloginfo() key you wish to return.

docblock.description: Current year as shortcode. Just uses PHP to fetch the current year. Possibly useful for copyright notices, freshening content, etc.

markers.todo: Support any phone number input here through shortcode and regex or something to clean non numerics and then reformat number for consistent display.

docblock.description: WordPress tweaks such as the email from name, search results per page, removal of archives, etc.
Define WordPress revisions.
Set WordPress email name.
docblock.long-description: Set the WordPress email name to reduce the potential problems with deliverability and remove "WordPress" from the from name.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The original email we are filtering on wp_mail_from_name.

docblock.description: Set number of posts per page on search results. Default 25.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The WordPress query, which we are checking to see if it is a search query.

docblock.description: Remove author and date archive pages.
Remove post tags, categories: DISABLED.
docblock.long-description: Remove post tags and category core WordPress functionality. Useful if you are building a site without a blog. Disabled by default.

docblock.description: Remove featured image/thumbnail support.
docblock.long-description: Remove Thumbnail/Featured Image support for posts and page types. Disabled by deafult.

docblock.description: Boot non-admin from wp-admin.
docblock.long-description: Redirects any URL with wp-admin for everyone but administrator-level users. Useful for building a site with users who should have no admin access. Defaults to disabled. This **requires a front-end login solution** (e.g., Theme My Login). Otherwise you'll be locked out of your WordPress admin until you edit out the boot again.

docblock.description: Strip admin bar from front end for all users except administrators.
Strip WordPress logo from login page.
Strip default WordPress dashboard widgets for cleaner experience.
Custom welcome widget.
docblock.long-description: Adds hidden content to admin_footer, then shows with jQuery, and inserts after welcome panel.

docblock.description: Remove "Howdy" in the WP admin bar.
Remove WP icon in upper right corner of WP admin bar.
Remove WP version in lower right corner of WP Admin.
Remove "Thank you" in lower left corner of WP Admin.
Replace "Thank you" in lower left corner of WP Admin with custom text (default blank).

parse_markers.error: Argument $wp_admin_bar is missing from the Docblock of kmw_replace_howdy
Argument $content is missing from the Docblock of kmw_edit_text
